node.title: Australia's audiovisual history 'secured' after funding boost for national institutions
node.alt: a roll of film being developed
node.description: The federal government pledges $47 million to help Australia's national institutions digitise at-risk audio-visual files held on magnetic tape.
node.content:
["Historical footage of Australian life in the 20th century will be saved after the National Film and Sound Archive\u00a0(NFSA)\u00a0secured\u00a0$41.9 million in federal funding.\u00a0", "The federal government announced the funding for the NFSA today, which will go towards\u00a0digitising\u00a0at least 240,000 items, many of which are stored on magnetic tape \u2014\u00a0a format that degrades over time.", "The funding for the NFSA will\u00a0also benefit seven other national collecting institutions, including the Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies (AIATSIS), Australian National Maritime Museum, Australian War Memorial, National Gallery of Australia, National Library of Australia, National Museum of Australia, and Questacon.", "The NFSA said it hoped the\u00a0financial boost would \"secure the future\" of Australia's audiovisual heritage.\u00a0", "", "
The system used by the National Film and Sound Archive\u00a0to digitise film.(Supplied)
", "
Digitisation to 'connect' Australia's 'lived past'
", "National institutions, including the NFSA, have called for funding in recent years to help save images and film that was at risk of\u00a0being lost.", "NFSA\u00a0chief executive\u00a0Patrick McIntyre\u00a0said today's investment would do just that \u2014\u00a0better connecting Australia with its past.", "\"We thank the government for responding to this urgent need to protect our audiovisual heritage. It represents a major commitment to preserving Australia's history for future generations,\" Mr McIntyre said.", "\"And audiovisual media keep these stories alive in uniquely vital and moving ways. This boost in funds will allow us to get ahead of the risks of obsolete playback equipment and deteriorating tape formats.\"", "", "
National Film and Sound Archive\u00a0CEO Patrick McIntyre and acting director-general from the National Library Cathy Pilgrim.(ABC News: Toby Hunt)
", "The NFSA holds more than three million items including videos, sound recordings and images of Australian history.", "The material to be preserved as a result of the funding will include the\u00a0Australian War Memorial's peacekeeping collection, the NFSA home movie collection depicting Australian life throughout the 20th century, the personal recordings and film of Sir Robert Menzies held by the National Library of Australia, and \"important cultural material\" held by AIATSIS.\u00a0", "Many of these items are held on magnetic tape, and the items considered most at-risk will be digitised first.\u00a0", "\"Digitising our collection \u2014 our memories \u2014 is a major ongoing process.", "\"We look forward to collaborating with other cultural institutions and establishing workflows to support large-scale digitisation. This is a critical project that will benefit all Australians.\"", "", "
The National Film and Sound Archive\u00a0stores more than three million items depicting Australia's history.\u00a0(Supplied)
", "
Money will also boost online archive Trove
", "Over the next two years,\u00a0$5.7 million will also support the\u00a0National Library of Australia's (NLA) Trove website, which allows digital access to millions of newspapers and other works from the NLA's collection.", "Federal Arts Minister Paul Fletcher\u00a0said the funding would permit technical upgrades on the site.", "\"Since its launch in 2009, Trove has become one of the most popular and comprehensive cultural websites in Australia, receiving approximately 30 million visits each year.", "\"With digitised collections, Trove provides easy access to important cultural material from a digital-first, always accessible online database.\"", "Federal Treasurer Josh Frydenberg said the $41.9 million would protect \"important elements\" of Australia's history.\u00a0", "\"As Australia's audiovisual archive, the NFSA has more than three million items in its collection, including a significant number of film, video and sound recordings in analogue formats,\" Mr Frydenberg said.", "\"This funding will protect important elements of Australia's audiovisual history from being permanently lost due to material deterioration.\"", "ACT senator Zed Seselja said today's announcement would also contribute to Canberra's economy.\u00a0", "\"Our national institutions play an important role in the Canberra economy, traditionally attracting millions of visitors a year providing a boost to our tourism and hospitality sectors,\" Mr Seselja said."]
